sections.heading: Core Function
sections.content: だけ expresses neutral limitation - "only" or "just" without negative nuance.

sections.heading: Main Use
sections.content:
Only/just (neutral choice):

これだけ - "only this" 一つだけ - "just one" 水だけ - "only water" 三つだけください - "just three, please"

No negative implication - simply stating a limit.

sections.heading: Replaces Particles
sections.content: 私だけ - "only me" (が→だけ) 本だけ - "only books" (を→だけ)

children.heading: Quantity
children.content: [Number]だけ 一つだけ - "just one" 少しだけ - "just a little"

children.heading: Limitation
children.content: [Noun]だけ これだけ - "only this" 日本語だけ - "only Japanese"

children.heading: Verb + だけ
children.content: 見るだけ - "just look" 聞くだけ - "just listen"

sections.heading: だけ vs ばかり vs しか
sections.content: | Particle | Nuance | Example | | -------- | ------------ | -------------- | | だけ | Neutral | 水だけ飲む | | ばかり | Excessive | 水ばかり飲む | | しか | Insufficient | 水しか飲まない |

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Neutral "only" ✓ No negative nuance ✓ Most common for "just" ✓ Replaces を/が

Related:

ばかり (bakari) しか (shika)
